page.title: 15Employment on Denbigh Farms
page.content: Although this area is mainly an {agricultural}community{mechanisation has meant that farms could be managed with a minimum of hired labour, thus, the number of employed workers has decreased considerably.Our{Farming {Survey}showed that most farms have{3 {tractors}and that preparation of land and harvesting of crops was done by contractors or farmer and seasonal workers. Only the farmer mainly worked full time, some farmers had other jobs so were part-time. Many farms recently added{modern buildings}again cutting down on labour.The farmer works a long day rising before{6am,}he takes short holidays under{7 days}or between{7-14. {Trips to market}are often the only time to take a{break}and{holidays}are often taken up with{visits}to{agricul- {-tural shows}to see{exhibits}and new {machinery}and have a{family outing.
